content.question: Let <math alttext="k"><semantics><mi>k</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="w"><semantics><mi>w</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="z"><semantics><mi>z</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> be positive constants. Which of the following is equivalent to <math alttext="log subscript 10 open parentheses fraction numerator k z over denominator w squared end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>z</mi></mrow><msup><mi>w</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="log subscript 10 open parentheses k plus z close parentheses minus log subscript 10 open parentheses 2 w close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>z</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>w</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="log subscript 10 k plus log subscript 10 z minus 2 log subscript 10 w"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>z</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>w</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="log subscript 10 k plus log subscript 10 z minus 1 half log subscript 10 w"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>z</mi><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>w</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="log subscript 10 k minus log subscript 10 z plus 2 log subscript 10 w"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>z</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>w</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="log subscript 10 k plus log subscript 10 z minus 2 log subscript 10 w"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>z</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>w</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
